title: hamburgefontsiv
content:
**[Indices](http://web.archive.org/web/20141007082951/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Indices) : [Terminology](http://web.archive.org/web/20141007082951/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Terminology) : hamburgefontsiv**

[Hamburgevons?](http://web.archive.org/web/20141007082951/http:/typophile.com/node/787)

[Hamburgefonstiv, &c.](http://web.archive.org/web/20141007082951/http:/typophile.com/node/34493)

[_Hamburgevons_; Where Did It Come From?](http://web.archive.org/web/20141007082951/http:/typophile.com/node/1273)

[Typeface Design Question](http://web.archive.org/web/20141007082951/http:/typophile.com/node/1273)

Hamburgefontsiv, OHamburgefontsiv, Hamburgefons, or even just Hamburg is a common test string for judging a typeface's design or a design's progress.

Several foundries have used this word to help assess submissions from independent designers, including [ITC](http://web.archive.org/web/20141007082951/http:/typophile.com/wiki/ITC) during (at least) the 1980s.

The stringmay have first been created at the [D. Stempel AG](http://web.archive.org/web/20141007082951/http:/typophile.com/wiki/D.%20Stempel%20AG) foundry sometime before the Second World War. Its "author" there would have been [Dr. Rudolf Wolf](http://web.archive.org/web/20141007082951/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Dr.%20Rudolf%20Wolf), who among other things was the designer of the [Memphis](http://web.archive.org/web/20141007082951/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Memphis) type family. [August Rosenberger](http://web.archive.org/web/20141007082951/http:/typophile.com/wiki/August%20Rosenberger) may have been involved. He cut several of Memphis' weights, and would later cut designs of [Hermann Zapf](http://web.archive.org/web/20141007082951/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Hermann%20Zapf)'s, including [Palatino](http://web.archive.org/web/20141007082951/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Palatino).

Before the digital-era, this was by no means a universal string. Several American foundries began typeface design testing with the letters **Hono**.
author: Alessandro Segalini
